title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. The Department of Defense

C. The Council of Economic Advisers

D. The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services

---

2. Who just vowed to stop selling ads based on your browsing activity across multiple websites?

A. Facebook

B. Google

C. Twitter

D. All of the above

---

3. Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy, convicted of trying to bribe a magistrate, is also being probed for allegedly accepting campaign funds from whose regime?

A. Vladimir Putin

B. Saddam Hussein

C. Moammar Gadhafi

D. Angela Merkel

---

4. Hippo Enterprises plans to go public. What business is it in?

A. Hippopotamus farming

B. Home insurance

C. Health insurance

D. Electric armored cars

---

5. Vernon Jordan died at 85. A civil rights leader and Washington insider, he eventually joined an investment bank. Which one?

A. Goldman Sachs

B. Salomon Bros.

C. Lazard Freres

D. Morgan Stanley

---

6. What surpassed 3% for the first time since July?

A. Kids attending school in person

B. Rates on 30-year fixed-rate mortgages

C. Adults with a normal body mass index

D. Inflation

---

7. Six Dr. Seuss books deemed offensive will no longer be published. Which of these was among them?

A. "Horton Hatches the Egg"

B. "Green Eggs and Ham"

C. "McElligot's Pool"

D. "The Lorax"

---

8. Which country is embracing small nuclear reactors in pursuit of zero emissions?

A. Japan

B. France

C. Israel

D. Canada

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. B

3. C

4. B

5. C

6. B

7. C

8. D
